newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: United's Dunne has commanding electorate lead - poll.
newsitem.headline: United's Dunne has commanding electorate lead - poll.

text.p: United NZ's Peter Dunne has an overwhelming lead in the Ohariu-Belmont electorate, according to a One Network News-Colmar Brunton poll quoted in the Dominion newspaper.
Dunne rated 46 percent support among decided voters, with Labour's Verna Smith trailing in second on 14 percent.
National is not running a candidate against its coalition partner in the seat.
On the party vote, National led on 48 percent, with Labour in second place on 15 percent.

If Dunne wins Ohariu-Belmont, he will ensure United is represented in the next parliament even if, as polls indicate is likely, it falls short of the five percent threshold in the party vote. -- Wellington newsroom 64 4 4734 746
